basic_info.description: Software Developer based in Bellingham, WA. I received both my B.S. in physics and B.A. in Economics/Mathematics from  Western Washington University.While completing my studies, I research organic solar cells in the physics department in the lab of Dr. Leger. I have tutored mathematics, physics, biology, chemistry, and history.

projects.title: Cloud Ten
projects.description: A site created for my Code Fellows 201 final, written in only vanilla html, css, and javascript. The user can user a calendar to organize their tasks and events. Information input by the user is persisted in local storage. I was the head developer for the calendar feature. In addition, I contributed ideas for branding, the general desired feel of the site, and I was the senior presenter of our final project.

projects.title: Solar cell research
projects.description: I research organic solar cells based on polymerizable ionic liquid. Over three years, I experimented, optimized, and tested different ionic solutions, testing regiments, and device architectures. I presented my finding at the American Physical Society March meeting in Baltimore, Maryland.

projects.title: Final project 301
projects.description: Another great project at Code Fellows
